alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 5:03PM CDT until June 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Kimble County in west central Texas... Western and Northwestern Mason County in west central Texas... Southeastern Menard County in west central Texas... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 500 PM CDT, radar indicated slow-moving thunderstorms with very heavy rain across the warned area. Rainfall of 1 to 3 inches has already fallen, and an addition 1 to 2 inches is likely with locally higher amounts possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Saline, London, Long Mountain, Hext, Yates Crossing, Streeter, Grit, Camp Air, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Erna, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773 and Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... crossings along FM 1221, Turkey SpringS crossing, Red crossing Little Bluff Creek, Hungry Hollow crossing, Long Mountain crossing, Chimney Hollow crossing Big Bluff Creek, County Road 370 crossing Big Saline Creek, County Road 351 crossing Big Saline Creek, County Road 370 crossing Big Saline Creek and Sandy crossing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
